clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial to Investigate Therapeutic Vaccine (RUTI) Against Tuberculosis (TB)
clinical_study.official_title: Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Phase IIb Clinical Trial to Investigate the Efficacy of RUTI® Therapeutic Vaccination as Adjuvant of Tuberculosis Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, randomized, double-blind, multicentre, placebo-controlled clinical phase IIb trial to evaluate efficacy of RUTI® vaccine in DS- (Drug-Sensitive) and MDR-TB (Multidrug-resistant) patients favourably responding to standard MDR-TB treatment. Time point of vaccination starts upon completion of 1 week of standard DS-TB treatment (cohort A), and another cohort of patients will be vaccinated upon completion of 1 month of standard MDR-TB treatment (cohort B). All the patients will be followed up to the end of the treatment.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with Sputum Culture Negative
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Week 2 for Cohort A and Month 1.5 for Cohort B
primary_outcome.description: Difference between intervention and control group

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with Sputum Culture Negative
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Week 8 for Cohort A and Month 6 for Cohort B
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between intervention and control group

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with reduction of bacillary load
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Week 2 and 8 (Cohort A); and Months 1.5 and 6 (Cohort B)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between intervention and control group based upon Time to detection (TTD) signal in MGIT

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with improvement of clinical signs and symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Week 2 and 8 (Cohort A); and Months 1.5 and 6 (Cohort B)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference between intervention and control group based upon Bandin

other_outcome.measure: Clinical safety parameters related to vaccination
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 2 year
other_outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) by CTCAE v4.0
Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.0 in terms of site of injection for redness, pain, swelling, induration and functional limitation

arm_group.description: A dose of 25 μg of of RUTI vaccine will be given at week 1 (Cohort A-DS TB Patients) or month 1 (Cohort B-MDR TB Patients) after starting standard TB treatment.
Placebo will be given at week 1 (Cohort A-DS TB Patients) or month 1 (Cohort B-MDR TB Patients) after starting standard TB treatment.

intervention.description: Participants randomised to this arm will receive one single dose of RUTI® vaccine in the right/left deltoid muscle.
Participants randomised to this arm will receive aone single dose of matching RUTI® placebo in the right / left deltoid muscle.
